p: Dengue is the most common mosquito-borne viral disease worldwide, causing 50â€“100 million infections annually [1]. It is endemic in most tropical and subtropical parts of the world, especially in urban areas, many of which are popular travel destinations. Accordingly, ongoing dengue epidemics have manifested themselves as an increasing number of infections not only in endemic populations, but also among travelers returning from the dengue endemic areas [2], [3].
